Ok, good to know. But I think it's important to underline that "stuff like Casper FFG" and "stuff like Peercoin" are very different categories of algos, and the former does not inherit many vulnerabilities of the latter.
I don't blame the author; BFT is legitimately harder to grok than "follow the longest chain". But it really does solve the issues.
The description of "Defense 2" betrays a total lack of understandimg of how the casper FFG mechanism gets around these issues safely in 2 rounds. No escalation of deposits required.

> Indeed the process of changing your mind and switching to the majority to ensure the network converges is the point of the consensus system The whole point of casper FFG is to allow changing your mind in "legitimate" ways but not "illegitimate" ways. So this is not an issue
> Risk of a loss of funds Partial slashing solves this. If one validator screws up or gets hacked, their losses are small unless many other validators get slashed around the same time
Strongly disagree; chain selection is much harder than block production. I personally see few obstacles between hybrid PoS and full PoS
